reviews.review_msg: Dr. Perkin's is the only professor that I have ever encountered, at a university level, that picks favourites among her students. I was shocked and disgusted. While her lectures are engaging and the assignments suit the classes material, her arrogance and lack of social skills takes away from the courses energy.

Charmaine has a very unique way of conducting a class. At times I down right could not stand the course, I think this gets confused with the quality of the professor. She holds people to a very high standard, I found when I went to talk to her she wouldn't hand out answers. I really respect this professor, and her way of teaching grew on me.

I've taken 3 classes Dr. Perkins and have never had a prof as helpful and caring. However, she does not hands us everything on a platter... & this is where she gets her bad rep (students believe they are entitled to all answers and undeserving grades). but she does not mark their work. She is very helpful during office hours & always extends it
Unapproachable, super condescending and straight up rude. Her expectations were way to high for a third year course. Avoid her at all costs!!!!!!!

Dr. Perkins is the toughest grader I have come across at SFU. She does not give great feedback, she is not helpful when going to see her in her office hours and honestly I found her disrespectful and harsh. In lecture, she tells the class how horribly everyone did on their papers, and just yells to read the textbook. Skips slides, unprepared.

I feel like the only way to get a decent grade on her written assignments is to have the writing level of a grad student in an undergraduate course. This is the hardest I have ever worked in any course and I feel like I'm only going to get a c- if I'm lucky.

This should be a 4-5 credit course. Takes two months to give you approval for your research project on top of weekly discussions, group projects, a paper to write, a final exam and a project that takes weeks to complete. Prime example of giving way too much work in order to justify your useless research style and try to make it seem legitimate.
One of my favorite teachers at sfu. Very inspiring and actually cares for your success. The challenge experienced in her classes is what should be expected in University. Big thumbs up.

Will not take her class again, really difficult to meet her standards, and I personally think her papers are over cite, basically you have to cite every single setence in your paper which I find it hilarious to do so. I would not consider her as rude, but not the nicest prof.

She has a sense of humour but that's it. She's very strict, even tried hard on writing her papers, still gives bad grades, expect students reach upper-level writing standards. Do not know what I've learn from this class, she'll skip slides and cant follow up and unable to type notes. Avoid her if u can. GPA dropper

Decently clear grading requirements but tough grader. I found Perkins difficult to talk to and harsh in how she responded to myself. For a class that is supposed to be analytical it didn't much require much critical thinking in my opinion. When I did try to talk to Perkins in office hours she shut me down quickly and didn't seem interested.

This is my second time taking a class with Dr. Perkins. She is helpful, understanding and very clear on her guidelines. As long as you follow her guidelines, you will succeed. Favourite professor at SFU! I would highly recommend Dr. Perkins to everyone - she shows true passion in teaching, which is why she is such an amazing professor!

Took this class with her in Fall 2017. Class consisted of weekly 10 liners, in class discussion, 3 critical reflections (6-8 pgs), and a book review (10-12 pgs), group presentation. A lot of writing but no exams. Has very clear guidelines for papers, lots of instructions, tells you exactly what she wants. Sarcastic humour (not rude!). Very caring!

One of the hardest classes I've taken at SFU. One 30 minute presentation, weekly assignments, two papers - one was 10 pages and the other was 20 (you had to conduct your own research study). Charmaine is condescending at first but if you meet her outside of class she is quite helpful. Extremely hard marker, though.

Dr. Perkins is a very caring prof that wants to see her students succeed. If you put time and effort into the course and visit her office hours, you will do well! Will definitely take another class with her.

Really regretting this class, and were barely into it. She constantly feels the need (literally every lecture) to make fun of students. She mocks the class saying we think we know everything and that we think were experienced researchers, yet shes the only person Ive heard say this. Im sad I spent my hard earned $ on this course with her.

Dr. Perkins is a great lecturer and makes good points. She's a fair marker. BUT... and this is a huge BUT, she is very rude and condescending. You may feel discouraged to ask her questions in person or even email her because of the way she responds. Rudest professor I've ever had.

Started the take home midterm paper almost 2 weeks prior to the due date, but got the worst mark I have ever gotten in post-secondary. For the whole semester, she basically talked about how no one knew how to write a proper paper and it was disgraceful that not everyone was in upper level writing standards. Do not trust facebook. Avoid her.
Knows what she is teaching, but has very high expectations. Extremely strict, will only give you a decent grade if you meet her expectations perfectly. Would not recommend to anyone.

Dr Perkins is one of the few profs in the crim dept that actually challenges you to think and question your opinions, this is a class where you actually LEARN. Not an auto A: 2 papers, presentation and final exam. But I got an A by showing up and putting in some effort. Perkins has a bad rep for being scary and hard, but she is actually caring.

Contrary to popular belief, I think Dr. Perkins is a very fair professor. She is passionate about the topics in the course and encourages students to engage critically as future criminal justice practitioners. Yes, she may seem off-putting at first, but for an upper-level instructor she is thoughtful of students and tries her best to engage.
rude, condesending and unapproachable. doesnt actually like her students in my opinion.

She is a good prof, but super opinionated to the point where you have to cater all of your papers to her ideas or she gets pissed. LOTS of writing, really makes you work for the grade. Not a bad class per se but get ready to work.

Best prof I've had at SFU. Lots of papers and no exams. Come to class, participate, critically analyze class topics in your papers and you can do well. This professor is always available to talk to students, although she seems intimidating at first, she is actually very approachable.

Don't take if u think u can slack off & end with an A. She'll make u work for the grade. She challenges u to be critical & analytical while being supportive. She has a good sense of humor, is passionate & knowledgeable about what she teaches. Take a class with her if u want to be challenged & enlightened. Isn't that what university is about?!

This class is not an easy A: there are 3 (5-8 pg) papers-10% each, one book review (12-15pg.)-30 % and weekly canvas posts worth 15%. The lectures were inspiring and this prof is ALWAYS available to talk with. This is a REAL uni class where there is intelligent discussion, critical analysis, prep for real world. Take if u want to work hard & learn.
Tough marker. If you don't complete all assignments even if they are worth 1% she won't pass you. Also, her feedback on papers is VERY rude. Never had a prof be as unprofessional as Perkins.

Worst experience I ever had in my 4 years University life. Her marking system is very tough, and I received the lowest grade in my university time from her. However, she did prepare class for students with lots of information and knowledge, and her office hour is always avaliable. Overall, I strongly not recommandate if you want to maintain yourGPA

I really enjoyed this course. The material is really engaging and Dr. Perkins is a great lecturer and funny! I found her to be quite fair marking wise. As long as you put in effort you will be fine! It is a very writing-intensive course when you consider the papers and online weekly reading summaries. See if you can negotiate to take one paper out.

Dr. Perkins is extremely helpful if you actually make the effort to ask her for help. Office hours exist for a reason, and I found them extremely helpful in completing this course and making sure I was on track. She is a difficult marker, this is a W course, meaning your writing skills matter. Pay attention, edit your work, and go to office hours.
I took this course with her, but graded by TA. she was a nice person
Avoid Perkins at any cost.
Not friendly or helpful inclass or 1 on 1. Confusing lectures & vague guidelines. For sure regret taking this class w Perkins.

Quite possibly the toughest grader there is. She seems like a rude person in general. Avoid taking this class with her if you can. Lectures are boring. She doesn't provide the slides so you have to actually attend her lectures. Stay away!
make sure you ask for help when you need and come prepared to class! DO THE READINGS!!
Perkins gives assignments 1 day before u need to finish them. Last week sent something out over the weekend & expected us all to have it done by tutorial Monday.
Perkins  condescending & rude. ASKS WAY TOO MUCH. Not approachable. Dropped the class.
never had a prof be as mean as perkins. worst crim class ive had. gpa killer.
Very interesting class. If you really want to learn then take her. You need to work hard but this prof is really helpful and wants to see her student succeed.
Interesting prof, very supportive and Dr. Perkins is willing to help. I would take another class with her in a heart beat.

I got B- in the class, notes are not posted online.  have to read scholarly journals. a lot of assignments and 1 big project. Qualitative project requires a lot of time. she wants you to understand, define and apply relevant qual concepts for your project. textbook references help and are needed.

I have taken her before and she is a fantastic prof for 300 level classes. Make sure to put effort into her papers and ask for guidance because she will truly help. There is large research paper in this class, so be prepared to put your life on hold for at least a week. Her exams are fair, if you have have studied. Overall, awesome prof
Excellent Professor, very helpful and genuinely interested in supporting everyone. Very reasonable and I would take a another class with Dr. Perkins in a heart beat.
Very hard MT and Final, challenging class but somewhat interesting.. I don't know if i'd take a class with this prof again...She's nice though.

This class was quite challenging, but I thought it was really interesting. I always found Charmaine to be extremely helpful. When I emailed her any questions she responded with an answer quickly. I had to work really hard in this class, but I still enjoyed it and would take another class with this prof again.

Her expectations are way too high! The midterm and the exam were around 17 18 pgs long and there was barely enough time to finish!Expects u to write down every little detail about everything! Rushes thru lecture slides making it difficult to keep up!Comes off as rude and unapproachable. Intense class but if u work hard u'll do fine
Her class was very challenging and exams were super long and difficult. I kinda liked her but still, her notes weren't very helpful to prepare exams.

Must be self-motivated to get good grades.. her lectures are a bore; too much note taking; ppt's too brief; High expectations for MT/finals --basically gotta know everything in the text, and exams are intensive ! barely had enough time to finish .. overall, would not recommend
Charmaine is brilliant and compassionate about everything she teaches.  Although she has high expectations, she is very willing to help out.  Supersmart.
